content:
Rahim Merchant is a residency-trained pharmacist specializing in healthcare informatics. He leads a number of informatics governance and change management initiatives with OhioHealth, serves as a preceptor to pharmacy students and residents, and supports various data analytics and business intelligence projects throughout the organization. Current research projects include medication dispensing optimization, workload and productivity quantification, as well as clinical decision support for opioid prescribing.
With a robust background in both clinical pharmacy practice and data analytics, Rahim has been successful in “bridging the gap” between clinicians and IT staff. Clinical interests include cardiology and infectious disease. Technical skills include SQL scripting, Epic Willow Inpatient build, QlikSense development, and use of R for complex data manipulation.
summary: Rahim Merchant is a residency-trained pharmacist specializing in healthcare informatics. He leads a number of informatics governance and change management initiatives with OhioHealth, serves as a preceptor to pharmacy students and residents, and supports various data analytics and business intelligence projects throughout the organization.
title: Rahim Merchant, PharmD

content:
Rahim Merchant is a residency-trained pharmacist specializing in healthcare informatics. He leads a team of informatics pharmacists and analysts in supporting clinical applications, pharmacy automation, and data analytics at OhioHealth. Rahim also serves as a preceptor to pharmacy students and residents, and additionally, supports directly supports a variety of high-impact healthcare-IT changes throughout the organization. Current projects include deployment of deployment of an automated dispensing cabinet (ADC) and central pharmacy automation systems, implementation of pharmacy inventory and compliance workflows, and integration of new care site EHR systems.
With a robust background in both clinical pharmacy practice and data analytics, Rahim has been successful in “bridging the gap” between clinicians and IT staff. Clinical interests include cardiology and infectious disease. Technical skills include SQL scripting, Epic Willow Inpatient build, Business Intelligence dashboard development (QlikSense), and use of Python for complex data manipulation.
summary: Rahim Merchant is a residency-trained pharmacist specializing in healthcare informatics. He leads a team of informatics pharmacists and analysts in supporting clinical applications, pharmacy automation, and data analytics at OhioHealth. Rahim also serves as a preceptor to pharmacy students and residents, and additionally, supports directly supports a variety of high-impact healthcare-IT changes throughout the organization.
title: Rahim Merchant, PharmD
